alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Coastal Hancock; Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 29 at 3:45PM EST until January 30 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected with extensive blowing and drifting snow and whiteouts.Additional snow accumulations of 11 to 15 inches for a storm total of 17 to 22 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Central Penobscot, Interior Hancock, Southern Penobscot and Coastal Hancock Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel could be extremely dangerous. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and cause localized hazardous travel. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely dangerous. Do not travel. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.

area.areaDesc: Central Penobscot; Coastal Hancock; Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot
